p: The 2004–09 epidemic strains circulated in most of the Indian Ocean regions and other countries like India, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, France, Italy, China, Singapore, the Netherlands and Reunion Islands. All these strains clustered in panel ‘b’ and diverged from the initial strains of Tanzania and the Central African Republic reported during 1952–56 (ECSA genotype). The recently circulating CHIKV in countries like India, Bhutan, Vietnam, Cambodia, Myanmar, Thailand, USA, Mexico and Brazil were found to deviate from 2004–09 epidemic strains.
